column4: If I have xfce4 installed on Ubuntu, how can I start it from a command line?
I want gnome to be my default wm, but when I'm doing virtualization I want to use xfce
so I'd log out of gnome and start xfce
sorry
what's the term?
ok desktop environment
so...possible?
and for a lightweight wm you might want to try Icewm or fluxbox, XFCE has gained a few pounds as of late...
I don't need something super duper lightweight, but vmware running 2 windows 2008 server and a vista box is really demanding on my poor little computer
One thing nice bout ubuntu there's 1500 window managers in the repos to play around with :)
so how do I drop to CLI and launch another one? startx starts gnome of course
i know the feeling Brack10 i got win xp running as we speak on vbox ose
i use Icewm and fluxbox when I have my win XP VM running which is like almost 90% of the time :)
Ok if I use those instead of xfce will you tell me how to do it? :)
I can give you a few tips sure
launch a separate wm from cli that is
No I just need to know how to have gnome start with Ubnuntu, but have the ability to launch another window manager when needed from CLI
ive never done that before, I thought you meant from login
nah
I know that' just an xorg.conf thing
because I use vmware to run my test servers for my MS certs
I just do ctrl Alt Backspace and switch that way
